page.content: DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA The Danygraig/Port Tennant area grew up around the terminus of the Neath Tennant Canal where it entered Fabian's Bay. In the last quarter of C19th when the Swansea Docks were being built on the east sude of the river, Danygraig and Port Tennant began to grow rapidly. Many of the houses date from that time. They are stone-built and the district consists of two ribbon roads (Danygraig Rd. and Port Tennant Rd.) running east/west, connected by a grid of streets running north/south.
